attributes.action: Tony Blair to stand trial for war crimes against Iraq.
attributes.additional_details:
The legality of the invasion and occupation of Iraq has been widely debated. The then United Nations Secretary-General Kofi Annan said in September 2004 that: "From our point of view and the UN Charter point of view, it [the war] was illegal." 

Tony Blair should not get away with an illegal invasion of another country that led to over one million innocent people being killed.
attributes.background: Tony Blair should stand trial for war crimes if the Chilcot Inquiry rules the former prime minister broke international law by invading Iraq in 2003.
